--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0092 b) Date of Occurrence: 08/02/2023
c) Installation Details: Eagle Vision-9 - AC-9991-397 at
Regional Depot-A
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Avionics b) Date Component 17/02/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Electronic Warfare d) Main Assembly: Station-1 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Electronic Warfare Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-C
g) Part No.: AV-9089-Z4 h) Sl No.: SN-9329-120
i) Firmware Version: FW-8.4.646 j) Software Version: SW-2.83.847
k) Date of Installation: 07/02/2023 l) Date of Removal: 14/02/2023
Pg No: 101 Ln No: 19 Pg No: 94 Ln No: 29
m) Manufacturing Agency: Guardian Defense Industries n) Date, Month & Year January 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3019 Hrs / 975 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Flight management system database corruption. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Electromagnetic interference affecting sensor accuracy
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Electronic Warfare component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct detailed inspection of all similar components in fleet
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 13/03/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 15/03/2023 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 14/03/2023 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 16/03/2023 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 19/03/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
